page.title: 01INTRODUCING TICKHILL
page.content: Tickhill is a small town 7 miles south of Doncaster.Two main{roads}run through it,the A631 and the A60.Their junction,in the centre of the town is marked by a{monument,}which is called the Buttercross.Dating from 1831 it is a dome shaped roof supported by pillars.The{population}in 1981 was 4956 and the electoral roll was 4,000.The number of households was 1830.There are 2 schools Estfeld and the church school St.Marys.There is a Tudor building which used to be called St.Leonards Hospit which was used for lepers.It is now called the Parish Rooms. Although Tickhill is quite small it has 2 food stores,2 fruit shops,a doctors,a dentist,2 butchers and 4 expensive outfitters.Over the last 20 years Tickhill has grown considerably,old and new buildings now stand side by side.
